'It's kind of late...'%K%P
I was on my way home, carrying the dinner I'd\njust bought from a convenience store.%K%P
The world was dark around me, and there wasn't a\nsoul in sight.%K%P
'Well, this is what it's like here in this\ntown.'%K%P
Kannagi is an old fashioned town. There are only\na few small stores and workshops.%K%P
We're part of the city, so there's lots of\npeople, but most are older, so no one really\ngoes out at night.%K%P
The people here are generally quiet, and the\ntown has a mellow feel.%K%P
But lately there's been one recurring problem\ntroubling the area.%K%P
'Another blackout...'%K%P
These blackouts have been making the news every\nday lately.%K%P
If they'd just been simple blackouts, there\nwouldn't be so much fuss.%K%P
'Town of Constant Unexplained Blackouts'%K%P
Just as that news headline stated, Kannagi's\nblackouts were pretty frequent.%K%P
Several blackouts a day is enough to liven up\nany place.%K%P
Day or night, without any pattern, not even\nexperts could predict when they'd happen.%K%P
'It hasn't hit me personally yet, but all these\nblackouts cause a lot of problems.'%K%P
For those living here, the constant threat of\nblackout makes it impossible to relax.%K%P
And the areas affected can range from a few\nmeters to a few hundred meters, so there's no\nconsistency at all.%K%P
And it was even effecting the yen exchange rates\nfor some industries located in the area.%K%P
'If we only knew what was causing it, we could\ndo something!'%K%P
'Whoa... What the?!'%K%P
Suddenly, all the lights around me went out and\nthe night went pitch black.%K%P
'Is this what they're talking about? A\nblackout?'%K%P
All the lights in nearby houses and on the\nstreet were dark.%K%P
Buildings in the distance were still lit up, so\nthe only place hit was right here around me.%K%P
'This must be what was just on the news!'%K%P
It took me by surprise, being caught up in\nsomething I'd just been thinking about.%K%P
Going through something like this all the time\nwould be enough to drive someone crazy!%K%P
Also...%K%P
'So glad I stopped by the store on the way\nhome!'%K%P
If I'd gone to buy dinner any later, I'd have\nbeen stuck in the store!%K%P
'Huh? What the--!'%K%P
I was so focused on the blackout that I hadn't\nbeen watching the road... I just barely missed\nrunning into someone.%K%P
My body had reacted on reflex, so we both made\nit through unharmed.%K%P
'A g-girl?'%K%P
I only saw her for an instant, but it was a girl\naround my height.%K%P
I turned around instinctively, and saw the girl\nstumbling along unsteadily.%K%P
'I wonder if she's okay... Oh!'%K%P
The girl's body started shaking, and she fell\nwithout even trying to catch herself.%K%P
'Hey!'%K%P
As if timed to her fall, the surrounding lights\ncame back on.%K%P
It looked like the blackout was over.%K%P
'Never mind that, I should help...'%K%P
When I looked back at the girl, she was slowly\ngetting up off the ground.%K%P
'--gryyy...'%K%P
'Huh?'%K%P
'Hunnggghh... So hungryyy!'%K%P
Just as she shouted this, the streetlights\nflickered violently, and the just-restored power\nflicked back off.%K%P
'Another blackout?!'%K%P
And what's with that timing...%K%P
'Ugh... I'm...done for...'%K%P
The girl collapsed again.%K%P
'Ugh...'%K%P
'Ummm... Are you okay?'%K%P
I unconsciously held my breath as I approached\nthe groaning, twitching girl.%K%P
Her clothes were unusual, made in a rather sexy,\nyet traditional Japanese style.%K%P
Her figure was captivating, I found it hard to\nkeep my eyes off her.%K%P
Any one of her physical traits would have set\nher apart from regular humans.%K%P
Though I'd never seen one first hand, I already\nknew what she was.%K%P
'A goddess?'%K%P
I knew there were goddesses in our world, but\nI'd never met one before.%K%P
I'd seen Divine Idols performing on TV lots of\ntimes, of course.%K%P
Those goddesses somehow sparkled, and seemed\nlike a dream, forever out of reach.%K%P
But this goddess here was different from the\nones I'd seen on screens.%K%P
While her clothing exuded willfulness and\nindependence, her expression was quite strained.%K%P
'Uughhh...'%K%P
'Um, Ms. Goddess? Is something the matter?'%K%P
'Hngg... S-Somebody...'%K%P
'Y-Yes! What is it?'%K%P
'Someone, anyone...food...please...'%K%P
'You... Whoever you are. Food...please...'%K%P
Just then the goddess' stomach growled loudly.%K%P
'Wait, did you actually collapse because you're\nhungry?'%K%P
The goddess nodded quickly, still lying on the\nground.%K%P
So it appeared she was just hungry.%K%P
*Blink*%K%P
And she kept glancing at me.%K%P
*Blink blink*%K%P
Despite her collapsing, it appeared she was\nactually fine.%K%P
In fact, she'd probably be perfectly okay if I\njust left her like that.%K%P
*Stare*%K%P
My eyes met hers midthought as she stared at me.%K%P
Her gaze moved little by little downward and\ntowards my convenience store bag.%K%P
'Um... Would you like a bit of my dinner?'%K%P
'Seriously...?'%K%P
It looked as if her dreams had come true.%K%P
'Well, I was just going to have a late dinner,\nbut okay.'%K%P
'Oh... Oh, my... I can't take all of it, just\nhalf.'%K%P
'Uff... Just half... Half is fine...'%K%P
The way she made such a show of it made her seem\nlike a regular school girl.%K%P
'Go ahead and eat it all. I already ate\nsomething earlier, so I'll be okay.'%K%P
'Really? Cause if you ask for it back later, I\nwon't give it back.'%K%P
'I won't ask for it back. Let's call it an\noffering, so please, do eat all you want.'%K%P
'Woohoo! Thank you!'%K%P
The goddess jumped to her feet and stared at me\nwith puppy eyes.%K%P
And then the power came back as if it had been\non a timer.%K%P
'Ahhh... That was so good!'%K%P
The revived goddess had eaten my late-night\ndinner in a flash.%K%P
It was just an evening snack, so it wasn't\nlarge, but still substantial.%K%P
'Thank you! Oh, I thought I was gonna starve!\nYou saved my life!'%K%P
She was talking constantly, her demeanor totally\ndifferent from before.%K%P
Her clothing was revealing, and when she moved,\nlittle flashes of skin caught my eye.%K%P
Maybe being able to almost but not quite show\neverything was some kind of divine power.%K%P
'Huh? Why so quiet all of a sudden?'%K%P
'Sooo... You're a goddess, right?'%K%P
'That's right. Oh yeah, we haven't introduced\nourselves!'%K%P
'I'm Akane Tsubaki! Call me Akane!'%K%P
'My name's Sho Narumi.'%K%P
'Sho, huh... Yep, I like it!'%K%P
The goddess Akane repeated my name over and\nover, as if to memorize it.%K%P
'So, Ms. Akane, why did you wait to eat anything\nuntil you collapsed in the street?'%K%P
'Just Akane's fine. I'll call you Sho.'%K%P
'And don't be so formal! It gets on my nerves!'%K%P
'Oh, um...really?'%K%P
She seemed to be a very casual goddess.%K%P
'Don't sweat it! I said it was okay, so it's\nokay!'%K%P
Saying this, the well endowed goddess thrust out\nher chest.%K%P
She sure was a cheerful goddess.%K%P
'Gotcha, Akane. Is that better?'%K%P
She already said it was, but it never hurts to\ncheck.%K%P
'Yeah, that's the stuff!'%K%P
Akane flashed a satisfied smile.%K%P
I couldn't help but like her easygoing nature.%K%P
Indeed, just having her around was enough to\nmake me feel good; she was so upbeat.%K%P
'So, why did you end up collapsing from hunger\nanyway, Akane?'%K%P
'Huh?! Oh... Ummm...well...'%K%P
'I mean, you ate my dinner without a second\nthought, so it's not like you're fasting...'%K%P
'Yeah...that's...really...'%K%P
'Really what?'%K%P
She stared off into space.%K%P
Finally, she opened her mouth slowly, and\nstarted to  speak.%K%P
'I don't have any money.'%K%P
'Huh?'%K%P
I had been expecting something a bit more\nexotic...%K%P
'What do you mean, 'huh'?!'%K%P
'Well, it's true. I'm a destitute goddess!'%K%P
Akane started to pout, her shoulders slumped.\nShe clearly didn't like my reaction.%K%P
But something else was bothering me.%K%P
'But you're a goddess. Don't you live in a\nboarding house?'%K%P
'Well, I do, somewhere, sure, but I haven't been\nthere since the descent.'%K%P
Akane answered, still pouting.%K%P
She was putting on a show, but she seemed honest\nenough.%K%P
'I don't really care about my place. Honestly,\nI'd rather go see yours!'%K%P
'My place? And why is that?'%K%P
'Huh?! Well... Uh...'%K%P
And just then, a rich growl rose from her\nstomach again.%K%P
'You're still hungry?!'%K%P
'Ahaha... I guess so!'%K%P
'So... Is that a no?'%K%P
Akane came closer and looked at me with upturned\neyes.%K%P
As a guy, standing next to a young beauty\ndressed like Akane was enough to get my pulse\nracing.%K%P
'No... Um, I didn't say that...'%K%P
'Oh? Your face is turning red! Could it be that\nyou've started falling for my charms?'%K%P
'N-No, not at all!'%K%P
'Oh, is that so? How about this?'%K%P
She got excited and came closer, pushing her\ncleavage higher for me to get a better look.%K%P
There was so much to see... It would tempt any\nred blooded young man.%K%P
'Okay, okay! But I'm sort of staying in a\nboarding house myself too, so it's not like I've\ngot tons of food.'%K%P
'I can come? Yay!'%K%P
'Also, I can't just use the kitchen anytime I\nwant, so I have to check with my landlady\nfirst.'%K%P
'If she says no, then I'm sorry but that's\nthat.'%K%P
'Oh, I have faith that you'll convince her,\nSho!'%K%P
Akane smiled at me, oblivious to the reality of\nthe situation.%K%P
'*Sigh* Please don't get your hopes up.'%K%P
I took out my smartphone to get in touch with\nthe landlady.%K%P
'Huh?'%K%P
10 percent battery left.%K%P
'That's weird. Did I forget to charge it this\nmorning?'%K%P
'Is something wrong?'%K%P
'Oh, no. It's just my phone's battery is almost\ndead. I should still be able to make one call.'%K%P
Thinking about it made me nervous, though.%K%P
'Hm... You want me to take care of it?'%K%P
'Can you?'%K%P
'No problem! There's nothing a goddess can't do!\nProbably.'%K%P
'Probably?!'%K%P
'Well, yeah. I mean, goddesses aren't\nomnipotent, after all.'%K%P
'Come on now, can you really help?'%K%P
'Of course! I'm a goddess, aren't I? Piece of\ncake!'%K%P
Of course, she herself had said that goddesses\nweren't omnipotent.%K%P
'Oh, well then, do what you can. Just don't\nbreak it, okay?'%K%P
Puffing out her overflowing chest in confidence,\nAkane took my phone.%K%P
'Leave it to me! Mmkay, here we go... Boom!'%K%P
'Whoa... What the--?!'%K%P
There was an electric zap, and suddenly my\nbattery died and the phone turned off.%K%P
'Oops.'%K%P
'You messed up?!'%K%P
'Wow, maybe I'm just off today, or maybe it's\nbecause I'm so hungry...'%K%P
'Umm...'%K%P
'Heehee!'%K%P
